IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Jewish Museum is devoted to the collection, preservation, interpretation and dissemination of art and artifacts relating to the Jewish experience from ancient times to the present, throughout the world.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Jewish Museum is devoted to the collection, preservation, interpretation and dissemination of art and artifacts relating to the Jewish experience from ancient times to the present, throughout the world.
IRS990.Description: Museum Programs, General/Other: Presentation of exhibitions related to art and Jewish culture and corresponding educational programs for adults, children, families, school groups and adult groups.

Activity2.Description: Art Museum Conservation Programs: Acquisition, storage, conservation and maintenance of collection of judaica objects, art (sculpture, paintings and photographs), film related to art and Jewish culture.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Other income includes travelling exhibition fees, audio tour fees, member trip income, etc

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Museum's collection is comprised of approximately 28,000 objects related to Jewish religious and cultural history, including paintings, sculpture, works on paper, photographs, ethnographic material, archaeological artifacts, numismatics, ceremonial objects, and broadcast media materials. The collection is held for exhibition, education, and research and is administered and stored in accordance with a formal collection management policy approved by the American Association of Museums. The Museum maintains a policy that requires the proceeds from the sale of collection objects (deaccessions) be used to acquire other items for the collection.
The Museum's collection is comprised of approximately 28,000 objects related to Jewish religious and cultural history. The collection is held for exhibition, education and research purposes.

The Museum's endowment serves a variety of purposes including both donor-restricted endowment funds and funds designated by the Museum to function as endowments. The endowment supports numerous educational programs, as well as exhibitions, several staff positions and general operating expenses.
Museum shop cost of goods sold, including allocated expenses.
Museum shop cost of goods sold, including expense allocations.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Trustee is an employee of museum's insurance broker
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Commission paid directly to broker from insurance companies. Trustee is not actively involved in transaction.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: The museum uses auction houses to sell works of art contributed to the museum, the proceeds of which are then used to purchase other works of art in the future.
The museum does not capitalize its collection so it reported a zero amount in Form 990, Part VIII, Statement of Revenue, line 1g.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: One trustee is a partner with another trustee in real estate partnerships.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The museum has several membership categories based on level of contribution.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The form is initially prepared by the director of finance, with input from the appropriate staff members. The draft is reviewed by the Executive Director and Chief Operating Officer. In addition, the draft is reviewed by a designated individual on the Audit Committee, who is a CPA. After all comments have been addressed, the 990 is made available to the Executive Committee for their review before final submission.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The COO ensures that the conflict of interest policy statement from the trustees is completely annually and any conflicts noted and discussed with senior leadership. In regards to staff, the museum's personnel manual includes a conflict of interest policy statement and all staff are required to sign a statement acknowledging that they have read and understand all policies included in the manual.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The HR Director prepares a staff compensation spreadsheet, along with comparable salary data from other cultural organizations and presents it to the Compensation Committe on an annual basis. The information is reviewed and ultimately approved by this committee, which consists of several members of the organization's Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The museum provides the applicable information/returns to anyone who requests such information in a timely fashion. In addition, the form 990 is available on Guidestar and other information is provided to such organizations as the Better Business Bureau.
